title: The fishstatR package
text: function returns index code lists defined folder Metadata, table name EBXCodelist.
code: library(faoebx5) library(fishstatr) GetEBXCodeLists() #   Identifier                        Acronym       Folder                   Name  Branch Instance # 6         100      CL_FI_COMMODITY_CPC_CLASS    Commodity              CPC_Class Fishery  Fishery # 7         101   CL_FI_COMMODITY_CPC_DIVISION    Commodity           CPC_Division Fishery  Fishery

title: The fishstatR package
text: function returns index code lists defined folder Metadata, table name EBXGroup.
code: library(faoebx5) library(fishstatr) GetEBXGroups() #   Identifier                                Acronym from  to          Folder                              Name  Branch Instance # 1         100       HCL_FI_COMMODITY_CPCCLASS_ISSCFC  100 113    CommodityGrp             Group_CPCClass_ISSCFC Fishery  Fishery # 2         101      HCL_FI_COMMODITY_CPCCLASS_SPECIES  100 301    CommodityGrp            Group_CPCClass_Species Fishery  Fishery

title: The fishstatR package
text: function returns code-list.
code: # reading a code-list using the Acronym ReadEBXCodeList('CL_FI_COMMODITY_FAO_LEVEL1')

title: The fishstatR package
text: function returns group.
code: # reading a group using the Acronym ReadEBXGroup('HCL_FI_COMMODITY_FAOL1_FAOL2')

title: The fishstatR package
text: InsertEBXCodeList() UpdateEBXCodeList() used carefully, change original data stored EBX database. Regardless, function can run users rights insert update data EBX. Currently, faoebx5 implemmented function remove data EBX, can using EBX user interface. InsertEBXCodeList() function requires data frame new rows inserted. data frame must contain variables/columns original table. instance, code list FAO_Level1 following columns: #r names(cl_fao_level1). Therefore, new rows contain columns, can see data frame #cl_faolevel1_new. created data frame new rows, next step run function InsertEBXCodeList() specificating arguments: data data frame composed news rows inserted, cl_name code list name, folder folder name, branch branch name, instance instance name.
code: cl_faolevel1_new <- data.frame(    Identifier = 99999,    FAO_Code = 7L,    NameEn = "XXXX_English",    NameFr = "XXXX_French",    NameEs = "XXXX_Es"  ) library(faoebx5) library(fishstatr) InsertEBXCodeList(data= cl_faolevel1_new,                   sdmx_codelist_name  = 'FAO_Level1')

title: The fishstatR package
text: UpdateEBXCodeList() function works similarly InsertEBXCodeList(). Therefore, create data frame data desire update specify code list name, well folder name, branch name, instance name. example, just changed data stored column NameEs XXXX_Es Name spanish.
code: library(faoebx5)  library(fishstatr) cl_faolevel1_new$NameEs <- 'Name spanish'  UpdateEBXCodeList(data = cl_update,                   sdmx_codelist_name  = 'FAO_Level1')

title: The fishstatR package
text: Shows dimensions dataset interest. Defined datasets can listed using GetDatasets()
code: metadata <- ReadMetadata()  GetDatasetDimensions(metadata, datasetID = 1) # AttributeID ConceptID DimensionID                Name_En EBXCodelist    EBXName #  1:           5         1          11                Country         200    UN_Code #  2:         101         2          12          ASFIS species         301 Alpha_Code #  3:          41         8          13 FAO major fishing area         403       Code #  4:         151        30          14            Environment         502       Code

title: The fishstatR package
text: Shows dimension group datasets ConceptID. ConceptID returned GetDatasetDimensions().
code: metadata <- ReadMetadata()  GetDimensionGroups(metadata, dimensionConceptID = 1) #    Identifier             Acronym Sort EBXCodelist                                Name_En # 3           3           CONTINENT  102         201                              Continent # 4           4          GEO_REGION  103         208                    Geographical region # 5           5          ECON_CLASS  105         202                         Economic class # 6           6          ECON_GROUP  106         203                         Economic group

title: The fishstatR package
text: Takes GetDimensionGroups uses information GetDimensionGroups() returns list call solutions. solution documents possible paths parent child. case Species, aretwo solutions: MAJOR->ORDER->FAMILY->ITEM MAJOR->ORDER->ITEM. used ReadEBXHierarchy() resolves solution.

title: The fishstatR package
text: Returns desired grouping, example Species: MAJOR(306) ITEM(301). uses GetGroupConnectionIDs() discover solution(s), resolves solution(s) actual groupings. Levels combined provide final grouping result. ASFIS code-list 12751 references.
code: result <- ReadEBXHierarchy(306,301) # [1] "  parentID=306, childID=307, sdmxGroupName=HCL_FI_SPECIES_MAJOR_ORDER" # [1] "  parentID=307, childID=302, sdmxGroupName=HCL_FI_SPECIES_ORDER_FAMILY" # [1] "  parentID=302, childID=301, sdmxGroupName=HCL_FI_SPECIES_FAMILY_ITEM" # [1] "  parentID=306, childID=307, sdmxGroupName=HCL_FI_SPECIES_MAJOR_ORDER" # [1] "  parentID=307, childID=301, sdmxGroupName=HCL_FI_SPECIES_ORDER_ITEM" # nrow(result) # [1] 12751

title: The fishstatR package
text: Converts data frame group (first column: group, second column: member) data table, group appears , members converted list. essential utlity function, use applicaitons. also used library flattening (combining) multiple levels hierarchies.

title: The fishstatR package
text: convenience function; ReadEBXHierarchy() uses codelist names. result resolved grouping ReadEBXHierarchy()
code: GetEBXHierarchy('CL_FI_SPECIES_MAJOR', 'CL_FI_SPECIES_ITEM') # [1] "  parentID=306, childID=307, sdmxGroupName=HCL_FI_SPECIES_MAJOR_ORDER" # [1] "  parentID=307, childID=302, sdmxGroupName=HCL_FI_SPECIES_ORDER_FAMILY" # [1] "  parentID=302, childID=301, sdmxGroupName=HCL_FI_SPECIES_FAMILY_ITEM" # [1] "  parentID=306, childID=307, sdmxGroupName=HCL_FI_SPECIES_MAJOR_ORDER" # [1] "  parentID=307, childID=301, sdmxGroupName=HCL_FI_SPECIES_ORDER_ITEM"

title: The fishstatR package
text: Reads information dataset’s dimensions hierarchies creates Rdata file.
code: dataset_ID <- GetDatasets(metadata)[1,'Identifier']  datasetName <- GetDatasets(metadata)[1,'Acronym']  ReadDatasetCodelists(metadata, dataset_ID) #  [1] "=== saved 72 to AQUACULTURE.RData, size=23293352" # #  load(file = paste0(datasetName,'.RData')) #  > ls() #  [1] "Dimensions"                            "COUNTRY.Codelist"                    "COUNTRY.Groups" #  [4] "COUNTRY.CONTINENT.Codelist"            "COUNTRY.CONTINENT.Groups"            "COUNTRY.GEO_REGION.Codelist" #  [7] "COUNTRY.GEO_REGION.Groups"             "COUNTRY.ECON_CLASS.Codelist"         "COUNTRY.ECON_CLASS.Groups" #  [10] "COUNTRY.ECON_GROUP.Codelist"          "COUNTRY.ECON_GROUP.Groups"           "COUNTRY.COMMISSION.Codelist" #  [13] "COUNTRY.COMMISSION.Groups"            "COUNTRY.ECO_REGION.Codelist"         "COUNTRY.ECO_REGION.Groups" #  [16] "COUNTRY.OTHER_COUNTRY_GROUP.Codelist" "COUNTRY.OTHER_COUNTRY_GROUP.Groups"  "SPECIES.Codelist" #  [19] "SPECIES.Groups"                       "SPECIES.YEARBOOK_GROUP.Codelist"     "SPECIES.YEARBOOK_GROUP.Groups" #  [22] "SPECIES.ISSCAAP_DIVISION.Codelist"    "SPECIES.ISSCAAP_DIVISION.Groups"     "SPECIES.ISSCAAP_GROUP.Codelist" #  [25] "SPECIES.ISSCAAP_GROUP.Groups"         "SPECIES.MAIN_GROUP.Codelist"         "SPECIES.MAIN_GROUP.Groups" #  [28] "SPECIES.ORDER.Codelist"               "SPECIES.ORDER.Groups"                "SPECIES.FAMILY.Codelist" #  [31] "SPECIES.FAMILY.Groups"                "SPECIES.SPECIES_GROUP.Codelist"      "SPECIES.SPECIES_GROUP.Groups" #  [34] "SPECIES.CPC_DIVISION.Codelist"        "SPECIES.CPC_DIVISION.Groups"         "SPECIES.CPC_GROUP.Codelist" #  [37] "SPECIES.CPC_GROUP.Groups"             "SPECIES.CPC.Codelist"                "SPECIES.CPC.Groups" #  [40] "AREA.Codelist"                        "AREA.Groups"                         "AREA.INLAND_MARINE.Codelist" #  [43] "AREA.INLAND_MARINE.Groups"            "AREA.OCEAN.Codelist"                 "AREA.OCEAN.Groups" #  [46] "AREA.SUB_OCEAN.Codelist"              "AREA.SUB_OCEAN.Groups"               "AREA.FA_REGION.Codelist" #  [49] "AREA.FA_REGION.Groups"                "ENVIRONMENT.Codelist" # #   subset(get("COUNTRY.Codelist"),Identifier==29|Identifier==45|Identifier==24, #          select=c('Identifier','Name_En','UN_Code','ISO3_Code')) #     Identifier                  Name_En UN_Code ISO3_Code #   24         24 British Indian Ocean Ter     086       IOT #   29         29                  Burundi     108       BDI #   45         45                  Comoros     174       COM #   get("COUNTRY.CONTINENT.Codelist")[2,] #     Identifier UN_Code    Name_En     Name_Fr   Name_Es #   2        359     002     Africa     Afrique    África #   head(get("COUNTRY.CONTINENT.Groups")) #     L1.group L2.member   NA NA.1 #  1      359        29 1900 9999 #  2      359        45 1900 9999 #  3      359        24 1900 9999 #  4      359        72 1900 9999 #  5      359       114 1900 9999 #  6      359        62 1900 9999 #  get('COUNTRY.CONTINENT.Groups.2')[[2,1]] #  [1] "359" #  head(get('COUNTRY.CONTINENT.Groups.2')[[2,2]]) #  [1] "29"  "45"  "24"  "72"  "114" "62"

title: Get the connections between two hierarchies — GetEBXHierarchy
Get the connections between two hierarchies — GetEBXHierarchy
text: sdmx_parent_codelist parent codelist name, SDMX style. sdmx_child_codelist child codelist name, SDMX style. Available code lists shown function GetEBXGroups field "Acronym". actual group ID location EBX5 (branch, instance, code-list-name) resolved using Metadata structure.

title: Get the connections between two hierarchies — GetEBXHierarchy
text: solution may invaolve several steps (list group ID's), may involve multiple step groupings, merged final result:    MAJOR(306)->ODER(307)->FAMILY(302)->SPECIES(301)    MAJOR(306)->ODER(307)->SPECIES(301) simplest case, matching group exists, list(ebx_parent_ID, ebx_child_ID) returned
